definition: certificate/proof/to prove/to demonstrate/to confirm/variant of 症[zheng4]
owner/master/host/individual or party concerned/God/Lord/main/to indicate or signify/trump card (in card games)
surname Yi/(Tw) abbr. for 義大利|义大利[Yi4 da4 li4], Italy

sentences.english: History positivism thought back in the early years of the 20th century has spread in China.
sentences.chinese: 實證主義史學思潮早在20世紀初年就已在中國傳播。

sentences.english: China is taking a rather Positivism stand toward its remodeling of political system.
sentences.chinese: 對於政治體制改革，中國採取了實證主義的立場。

sentences.english: Positivism flatly denies that any field of inquiry is open for teleological research.
sentences.chinese: 實證主義斷然否定那些採用目的論做研究的領域。

sentences.english: Hobbes is a precursor of modern positivism and analytical jurisprudence .
sentences.chinese: 霍布斯是現代實證主義法學和分析法學的先驅。

sentences.english: Conde positivism is closely related to Fayol theory of management process.
sentences.chinese: 孔德實證主義與法約爾管理過程論是密切相關的。

sentences.english: The positivist arrives at his point of view surreptitiously.
sentences.chinese: 實證主義者的觀點往往是“潤物細無聲”。

sentences.english: This system sublates the classic criminal theory system who is influenced by positivism.
sentences.chinese: 它是對受實證主義思潮影響的古典犯罪論體系的揚棄。

sentences.english: "Fen Shen" is akin to the concept of "Logos" – the Word - expounded in biblical positivism.
sentences.chinese: 分身猶如聖經實證主義中的邏各斯。

sentences.english: Such views of nature and history of the orientation of positivism has been a huge difference.
sentences.chinese: 此種見解自然與實證主義史學的取向已不可同日而語。

definition: the philosophy of materialism, doctrine that physical matter is the whole of reality
epistemology (in philosophy, the theory of how we know things)
slave-owning society (precedes feudal society 封建社會|封建社会 in Marxist theory)
Joseph Needham (1900-1995), British biochemist and author of Science and Civilization in China
